description: Lenart Kova decides to bypass city safeguards and triggers a citywide broadcast, connecting the vanished citizens' peer-to-peer network to all public screens.
Emergency override is authorized. Lenart's network reroutes standard display controls, preventing Council systems from blocking the outgoing signal.
Before dawn, every city display and billboard loops shifting images: faces of vanished citizens blend with Council leaders. Residents are stunned and digital panic spreads.

The city erupts with protest art, makeshift masks, and street gatherings inspired by the broadcast images. People organize mass investigations following hidden clues in the faces, searching for truths about the vanished.

Families of the missing, supported by the population, stage large rallies demanding answers. Council factions splinter: the Directorate calls for heavy surveillance, Innovators push for public dialogue, and the Harmonists lose influence.
